body.p:
Paris Ky April 26th 1862
Govr Magoffin,
Dr Sir,

at the present Term of the Bourbon Circuit, Judgts were rendered against W. Butler Hall and Jesse Fishback each for $100. for betting a small amount on the Result of the Presidential election in this state. The amount bet was so inconsiderable, "a twist of Tobacco," and the gentlemen are both men of habits so averse to all sorts of gaming, that upon their application and that of friends, I do feel inclined to ask your Excellency to remit the part due the common wealth -- with the intention upon my own part to make a proper abatement of my own fees

Bourbon Cir. Ct
$100 each } Betting
W. B. Hall
J. Fishback
Issd May 1, 1862
